comments.raw_text:
On my Mac,

Firefox 4 nightly 20110201: 5fps. 10fps with pixel snapping.
Safari 5: 10fps. 30fps with pixel snapping.
Opera 11: 6fps. 22fps with pixel snapping.
Chrome 10.0.648.11: 6fps. 28fps with pixel snapping.

The main issue here is that we are doing worse than everyone else.

The second issue is that web developers are required to do pixel snapping because of the general poor performance on Mac browsers, see http://sebleedelisle.com/2011/02/html5-canvas-sprite-optimisation/ .

comments.raw_text:
For the pixel-snapped version, time is all in drawImage, of course.  Obvious hotspots:

  10% the security check to see whether we need to taint the canvas
   7% getting an image surface from the image element
   5% some sort of cairo mungery
  55% the actual image paint

We do have existing bugs on drawImage performance, btw...
